intro: Cassine gymnosporiodes, commonly known as the smoothleaf cassine, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its smooth, broad leaves and showy, clustered flowers that range from white to pink in color. It typically grows in wetland or riparian habitats, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Cassine gymnosporiodes is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and floral display.
